info.title: Sensay API (Internal)
info.description: Complete API schema including hidden endpoints.

description.default: General-purpose model for everyday agentic workflows and Web3 applications.
Fast, responsive, and great for everyday tasks and smooth conversations. Handles most queries well with a light, natural tone.
Deprecated. Use claude-sonnet-4-5 instead. Balances thoughtful responses with practical conciseness, making it well-suited for both casual conversations and focused work tasks
Fast and highly efficient model optimized for quick responses, high-volume tasks, and cost-effective operations with reliable performance.
Advanced reasoning model with enhanced capabilities for complex problem-solving, coding, and analytical tasks.
Fast and to the point, great for short, clear answers. Not as detailed in complex topics.
Fast and efficient model with strong multimodal capabilities. Excellent for text, image, and code understanding with quick response times.
Advanced multimodal model with superior reasoning capabilities. Excels at complex analysis, research tasks, and handling large contexts with high accuracy.
A well-balanced model with strong reasoning and problem-solving abilities. Great for structured responses.
Smaller, faster, and more affordable version of GPT-4o for everyday tasks and high-volume use cases.
The best GPT model for coding and agentic tasks across domains.
A faster, more cost-efficient version of GPT-5 for well-defined tasks and precise prompts.
Fastest, most cost-efficient version of GPT-5. It's great for summarization and classification tasks.
Deprecated. Use grok-3-latest instead. Best for casual, creative, and engaging conversations. Fun and dynamic but may not always be highly precise.
Deprecated. Use grok-3-latest instead. Experimental model focused on casual, creative conversations. More dynamic and fun but may sacrifice some precision.
Advanced model for creative and engaging conversations. Offers improved reasoning while maintaining a dynamic and fun personality.
Latest generation Grok model with enhanced reasoning capabilities and improved accuracy for both creative and analytical tasks.
Handles large amounts of context well, good for general use, but not as advanced in complex reasoning.
Large open-source model with strong reasoning and versatile generation. Well-suited for complex tasks and broad domain applications.
Advanced reasoning model with strong performance across diverse tasks. Excellent for complex analysis, coding, and multilingual applications.

chat_type.description: Type of the chat, can be either `private`, `group`, `supergroup` or `channel`.

chat_name.description: Name of the chat (group name, channel title, or user display name for private chats).

user_id.description: Sender of the message's userID; may be empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats.

username.description: Sender of the message's username; may be empty for messages sent to channels. For backward compatibility, if the message was sent on behalf of a chat, the field contains a fake sender user in non-channel chats.

message_id.description: Unique message identifier inside this chat. In specific instances (e.g., message containing a video sent to a big chat).

message_thread_id.description: Unique identifier of a message thread or a forum topic to which the message belongs; for supergroups only.

post.description:
Ask for a completion and stores the prompt in the chat history.

  Replica chat supports two response formats: streamed and JSON. To switch between these formats, use the 'Accept' header, specifying either 'text/event-stream' for streaming or 'application/json' for JSON.
  The streamed response honours the [Stream Protocol](https://sdk.vercel.ai/docs/ai-sdk-ui/stream-protocol), allowing the use of a number of SDKs, including [Vercel AI SDK](https://sdk.vercel.ai/docs/introduction).

  The streamed variant is not specified in the OpenAPI Schema because it is not an OpenAPI endpoint.

schema.description: Content encoding for request body compression. Optional - when used, client is responsible for gzipping and sending binary data.

parameters.description: Content encoding for request body compression. Optional - when used, client is responsible for gzipping and sending binary data.
parameters.name: Content-Encoding

content.description: The prompt to generate completions for, encoded as a string.
content.example: How did you handle the immense pressure during the Civil War?

skip_chat_history.description: When set to true, historical messages are not used in the context, and the message is not appended to the conversation history, thus it is excluded from all future chat context.

source.description: The place where the conversation is happening, which informs where the message should be saved in the chat history.

monthlyQuota.description: The number of conversations allowed for this account in the current calendar month.

usageLimits.description: Usage policies and quotas to enforce for this completion request

200.description: List of chat messages had with a replica by the current user, including the completion

post.description:
Testing endpoint for evaluating RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) quality. This endpoint allows to test how effectively the system retrieves relevant knowledge base entries and generates responses based on them. It returns not only the generated response but also the search queries used and the knowledge base entries that matched those queries. This is a simplified version that doesn't persist data to the database or chat history.

  Note: This endpoint is restricted to internal RAG workers and is not intended for general API users.

schema.description: Content encoding for request body compression. Optional - when used, client is responsible for gzipping and sending binary data.

parameters.description: Content encoding for request body compression. Optional - when used, client is responsible for gzipping and sending binary data.
parameters.name: Content-Encoding

content.description: The prompt to generate completions for, encoded as a string.
content.example: How did you handle the immense pressure during the Civil War?

skip_chat_history.description: When set to true, historical messages are not used in the context, and the message is not appended to the conversation history, thus it is excluded from all future chat context.

200.description: Test endpoint for RAG Worker to check RAG retrieval and generation quality

success.description: Indicates if the test chat completion was processed successfully

content.description: The complete response text generated by the replica based on the retrieved knowledge base entries

post.description:
> warn
  > Limited [OpenAI Chat Completions API](https://platform.openai.com/docs/api-reference/chat/create) compatibility.
  > Supports basic chat completion with standard message roles and JSON responses.
  > Not supported: OpenAI-style streaming, tool calls, stop sequences, logprobs, and most request parameters.

  Creates a chat completion response from a list of messages comprising a conversation.

schema.description: Content encoding for request body compression. Optional - when used, client is responsible for gzipping and sending binary data.

parameters.description: Content encoding for request body compression. Optional - when used, client is responsible for gzipping and sending binary data.
parameters.name: Content-Encoding

role.description: The role of the message author. Can be "assistant", "developer", "system", "tool", or "user".

content.example: How did you handle the immense pressure during the Civil War?

name.description: An optional name for the participant. Provides the model information to differentiate between participants of the same role.

messages.description: A list of messages that make up the conversation context. Only the last message is used for completion.

example.content: How did you handle the immense pressure during the Civil War?

store.description: When set to false, historical messages are not used in the context, and the message is not appended to the conversation history.

source.description: The place where the conversation is happening, which informs where the message should be saved in the chat history if `store` is true.

200.description: Chat completion response in OpenAI compatible format

id.description: A unique identifier for the chat completion.

created.description: The Unix timestamp (in seconds) of when the chat completion was created.

object.description: The object type, which is always "chat.completion"

model.description: The model used for the chat completion.

index.description: The index of the choice in the array.

role.description: The role of the message author, which is always "assistant" for completions.

content.example: During the Civil War, I faced tremendous pressure...

tool_calls.description: The tool calls generated by the model, such as function calls.

message.description: The message generated by the model.

logprobs.description: Log probabilities for token generation if requested.

finish_reason.description: The reason the model stopped generating tokens.

choices.description: An array of chat completion choices.

prompt_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the prompt.

completion_tokens.description: Number of tokens in the generated completion.

total_tokens.description: Total number of tokens used (prompt + completion).

usage.description: Usage statistics for the completion request.

schema.description: The response format for chat completions.

purpose.description: The purpose of the replica. This field is not used for training the replica.
purpose.example: Acts as my AI twin for answering questions about my creative work.

shortDescription.description: A short description of your replica. This field is not used for training the replica.
shortDescription.example: Accountant from Brooklyn who loves sports.

greeting.description: The first thing your replica will say when you start a conversation with them.
greeting.example: What would you like to know?

type.description:
The replica type.
`individual`: A replica of yourself.
`character`: A replica of a character: can be anything you want.
`brand`: A replica of a business persona or organization.

private.description: Visibility of the replica. When set to `true`, only the owner and users on the allowlist will be able to find the replica and chat with it.

whitelistEmails.description: Emails of users who can use the replica when the replica is private.

slug.description: The slug of the replica. Slugs can be used by API consumers to determine the URLs where replicas can be found.

tags.description: The tags associated with the replica. Tags help categorize replicas and make them easier to find.

profileImage.description: The URL of the profile image of the replica. The image will be downloaded, optimized and stored on our servers, so the URL in the response will be different. Supported formats: image/jpeg, image/jpg, image/pjpeg, image/png, image/bmp, image/x-windows-bmp, image/x-bmp, image/x-bitmap, image/x-ms-bmp, image/webp, image/avif

suggestedQuestions.description: Suggested questions when starting a conversation.
example: What is the meaning of life?

anyOf.title: model
anyOf.description: The LLM model of the replica.

anyOf.title: claude-4-sonnet-20250514
anyOf.description: Deprecated. Use claude-sonnet-4-5 instead. Balances thoughtful responses with practical conciseness, making it well-suited for both casual conversations and focused work tasks

anyOf.title: grok-2-latest
anyOf.description: Deprecated. Use grok-3-latest instead. Best for casual, creative, and engaging conversations. Fun and dynamic but may not always be highly precise.

anyOf.title: grok-3-beta
anyOf.description: Deprecated. Use grok-3-latest instead. Experimental model focused on casual, creative conversations. More dynamic and fun but may sacrifice some precision.

model.description: The LLM model of the replica.

memoryMode.description: Deprecated. The system will automatically choose the best approach.

systemMessage.description: Who is your replica? How do you want it to talk, respond and act.

tools.description: The replica's tools. Tools enable agents to interact with the world. `getTokenInfo`: Allows replica to get token information

embeddingModel.description: The embedding model used for semantic search and knowledge base operations.

voicePreviewText.description: Text that can be used to generate a voice preview.
voicePreviewText.example: Hi, I'm your Sensay replica! How can I assist you today?

isAccessibleByCustomerSupport.description: Whether the replica conversations are accessible to customer support

isEveryConversationAccessibleBySupport.description: Whether the replica conversations are accessible to customer support

isPrivateConversationsEnabled.description: Whether private conversations are enabled for this replica (conversations not accessible to customer support)

heygenAvatarID.description: The HeyGen avatar ID associated with this replica.

voiceManager.description: The ElevenLabs voice ID associated with this replica.

short_description.description: The description of the replica. Please use `shortDescription` instead.

introduction.description: The introduction of the replica. Please use `greeting` instead.

created_at.description: The date and time the replica was created.

owner_uuid.description: The UUID of the owner of the replica. Please migrate to the new User ID system and use `ownerID` instead.

video_enabled.description: Whether the replica has video support.

Retrieves messages in a specific conversation within a chat with cursor-based pagination. Messages are sorted chronologically from oldest to newest.

Use the `beforeUUID` parameter to get older messages and the `afterUUID` parameter to get newer messages. Please note:

 - When `beforeUUID` and `afterUUID` are both specified, the most recent messages before `beforeUUID` are returned.
 - When `afterUUID` is specified on its own, the least recent messages after `afterUUID` are returned.

post.description: Creates a new knowledge base entry for a replica based on text, file, URL, or Youtube Videos. For YouTube playlists, the system will automatically create separate entries for each video in the playlist.

schema.description: Content encoding for request body compression. Optional - when used, client is responsible for gzipping and sending binary data.

parameters.description: Content encoding for request body compression. Optional - when used, client is responsible for gzipping and sending binary data.
parameters.name: Content-Encoding

title.description: Title for this knowledge base entry. Helps identify the content in listings.

url.description:
A public URL to an HTML page to ingest into the knowledge base.
The URL must be publicly accessible without authentication. Google domains(e.g. www.google.com, docs.google.com) are not allowed.
Only the rendered text on the web page is used for training, embedded media (image, video, audio) is not used. For training using video files, please provide YouTube links in one of the following formats: 
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VIDEO_ID
https://www.youtube.com/shorts/SHORT_VIDEO_ID
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLAYLIST_ID

autoRefresh.description: Whether to allow automatic content updates from the URL, handled by the system.

text.description: The text content you want your replica to learn
text.example: Our company was founded in 2020. We specialize in AI-powered customer service solutions.

filename.description:
The name of the file that you intend to upload. Supported file types:
- Documents: .doc, .docx, .rtf, .pdf, .pdfa
- Spreadsheets and Tabular Data: .csv, .tsv, .xls, .xlsx, .xlsm, .xlsb, .ods, .dta, .sas7bdat, .xpt
- Presentations: .ppt, .pptx
- Text Files: .txt, .md, .htm, .html, .css, .js, .xml
- Data Text Files: .json, .yml, .yaml
- E-books: .epub
- Images: .png, .jpg, .jpeg, .webp, .heic, .heif, .tiff, .bmp
- Audio Files: .mp3, .wav, .aac, .ogg, .flac
- Video Files: .mp4, .mpeg, .mov, .avi, .mpg, .webm, .mkv (Maximum duration: 90 minutes)

get.description: Returns a list of all knowledge base entries belonging to a replica. This endpoint allows you to view all your training data in one place, with optional filtering by status or type. You can use this to monitor the overall state of a replica's knowledge base, check which entries are still processing, and identify any that might have encountered errors. The response includes detailed information about each entry including its content, status, and metadata.

schema.description: Filter knowledge base entries by comma separated list of their processing statuses. Use this to find entries in specific states like `NEW` or `READY`.

parameters.description: Filter knowledge base entries by comma separated list of their processing statuses. Use this to find entries in specific states like `NEW` or `READY`.

patch.description: Updates a knowledge base entry with training content. This is the second step in the training process after creating an entry. You can provide "rawText" which is the content you want your replica to learn from (such as product information, company policies, or specialized knowledge). The system will automatically process this text and make it available for your replica to use when answering questions. The entry status will change to PROCESSING and then to READY once fully processed.

delete.summary: Delete knowledge base entry by ID
delete.description: Permanently removes a specific knowledge base entry and its associated vector database entry. Use this endpoint when you need to remove outdated or incorrect training data from your replica's knowledge base. This operation cannot be undone, and the entry will no longer be available for retrieval during conversations with your replica. In most cases, the deletion is completed immediately. However, in some scenarios, part of the deletion process may be delayed. This means that while the request has been accepted and the deletion process has started, some associated data may remain temporarily available and will be removed within 24 hours.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base entry
parameters.name: knowledgeBaseID

200.description: The knowledge base entry was deleted successfully.

success.description: Indicates the status of the request

202.description: The deletion process has been initiated. Full removal of all associated data may take up to 24 hours to complete.

success.description: Indicates the status of the request

message.description: The reason why the operation is accepted instead of returning an immediate success.
message.example: The deletion process has been initiated. Full removal of all associated data may take up to 24 hours to complete.

success.description: Indicates the status of the request

error.description: A text representation of the error

request_id.description: A unique identifier of the request, useful for reporting

example.error: A text representation of the error

get.summary: Get knowledge base entry by ID
get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific knowledge base entry using its ID. This endpoint returns the complete entry data including its type, status, content, and metadata. You can use this to check the processing status of your training content, view the raw and processed text, and see when it was created and last updated. This is useful for monitoring the progress of your training data as it moves through the processing pipeline.

patch.description: Updates a knowledge base entry with training content. This is the second step in the training process after creating an entry. You can provide "rawText" which is the content you want your replica to learn from (such as product information, company policies, or specialized knowledge). The system will automatically process this text and make it available for your replica to use when answering questions. The entry status will change to PROCESSING and then to READY once fully processed.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base entry
parameters.name: knowledgeBaseID

delete.summary: Delete knowledge base entry by ID
delete.description: Permanently removes a specific knowledge base entry and its associated vector database entry. Use this endpoint when you need to remove outdated or incorrect training data from your replica's knowledge base. This operation cannot be undone, and the entry will no longer be available for retrieval during conversations with your replica. In most cases, the deletion is completed immediately. However, in some scenarios, part of the deletion process may be delayed. This means that while the request has been accepted and the deletion process has started, some associated data may remain temporarily available and will be removed within 24 hours.

parameters.description: The unique identifier of the knowledge base entry
parameters.name: knowledgeBaseID

200.description: The knowledge base entry was deleted successfully.

success.description: Indicates the status of the request

202.description: The deletion process has been initiated. Full removal of all associated data may take up to 24 hours to complete.

success.description: Indicates the status of the request

message.description: The reason why the operation is accepted instead of returning an immediate success.
message.example: The deletion process has been initiated. Full removal of all associated data may take up to 24 hours to complete.

success.description: Indicates the status of the request

error.description: A text representation of the error

request_id.description: A unique identifier of the request, useful for reporting

example.error: A text representation of the error

get.summary: Get knowledge base entry by ID
get.description: Retrieves detailed information about a specific knowledge base entry using its ID. This endpoint returns the complete entry data including its type, status, content, and metadata. You can use this to check the processing status of your training content, view the raw and processed text, and see when it was created and last updated. This is useful for monitoring the progress of your training data as it moves through the processing pipeline.

get.description: Returns a list of all knowledge base entries belonging to a replica. This endpoint allows you to view all your training data in one place, with optional filtering by status or type. You can use this to monitor the overall state of a replica's knowledge base, check which entries are still processing, and identify any that might have encountered errors. The response includes detailed information about each entry including its content, status, and metadata.

get.description: Returns a list of all supported file types and MIME types for knowledge base entries.
